page.title: 12SHALBOURNE C OF E SCHOOL
page.content: The school is a small rural primary school drawing its children from{five {surrounding villages}two of which have had their schools closed. It has{three {classrooms}in which the children are grouped by age: infants 5-7 years, middle class 7-9, top class 9-11. At 11 most children transfer to{St John's {Comprehensive School}in{Marlborough. The school has its own kitchen and substantial playing field. There is a Head Teacher, Deputy Head, 1 full-time and 1 part-time teacher. There are 65 children, a high proportion under 9. Young children are accepted as rising fives. The Vicar visits regularly to meet the children and takes 1 assembly a week; a full range of subjects is taught, not in isolation but inte- grated in the form of a project. The school has close links with parents and there is an active{PTA.
